Steps.Message: Update at 19:07 - Our engineers are continuing to work on locating and repairing the faulty section of underground cabling. We know that with the current pandemic, our customers are more worried now than ever about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 6 hours in the fridge, and between 15-24 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. For more information, please see your terms of connection, which are usually provided by your supplier, but are available here https://bit.ly/2VvgXFi. Thank you.

We became aware of a power cut at 08:15. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

We know that with the current pandemic, our customers are more worried now than ever about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 6 hours in the fridge, and between 15-24 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. For more information, please see your terms of connection, which are usually provided by your supplier, but are available here https://bit.ly/2VvgXFi. Thank you.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on an underground electricity cable affecting the local area.
